Operation 'src.searchly.api.v1.controllers.similarity.by_song' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, not_actionable. Original summary uses generic 'API endpoint' language. Description lacks actionable details about what similarity means, how results are ranked, and what the operation returns. Added specifics about the KNN algorithm, word2vec embeddings, and result ranking to improve AI agent interpretability and domain context consistency.

data.current_summary: API endpoint to search similarity using a song identifier
data.current_description:
Endpoint for an end-user client to search similarity by song identifier.

If you want to run the /similarity/by_song operation, you can do so via an HTTP GET command to the following URL:

```
https://searchly.asuarez.dev/api/v1/similarity/by_song
```
data.summary_suggestion: Find similar songs by song identifier
data.description_suggestion: Searches for songs with similar lyrics to a specified song in the database using k-nearest neighbors algorithm. Accepts a song identifier as a query parameter and returns a ranked list of similar songs based on lyrical content similarity. Uses word2vec embeddings to compute semantic similarity.
data.reasoning: Original summary uses generic 'API endpoint' language. Description lacks actionable details about what similarity means, how results are ranked, and what the operation returns. Added specifics about the KNN algorithm, word2vec embeddings, and result ranking to improve AI agent interpretability and domain context consistency.

message: Operation 'src.searchly.api.v1.controllers.similarity.by_content' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, not_actionable. Original summary is too generic. Description doesn't explain that it accepts arbitrary text input, what format the request body should have, or how it differs from by_song endpoint. Added clarity about free-form text input, semantic similarity computation, and the key differentiator (no song ID required) for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_summary: API endpoint to search similarity using content
data.current_description:
Endpoint for an end-user client to search similarity by content.

If you want to run the /similarity/by_content operation, you can do so via an HTTP POST command to the following URL:

```
https://searchly.asuarez.dev/api/v1/similarity/by_content
```
data.summary_suggestion: Find similar songs by lyrical content
data.description_suggestion: Searches for songs with similar lyrics to arbitrary text content provided in the request body using k-nearest neighbors algorithm. Accepts free-form text (e.g., song lyrics or lyrical phrases) and returns a ranked list of similar songs from the database based on semantic similarity. Uses word2vec embeddings to compute lyrical meaning similarity without requiring an existing song identifier.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description doesn't explain that it accepts arbitrary text input, what format the request body should have, or how it differs from by_song endpoint. Added clarity about free-form text input, semantic similarity computation, and the key differentiator (no song ID required) for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'src.searchly.api.v1.controllers.song.search' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, not_actionable. Original summary and description lack specificity about search scope (metadata vs. lyrics) and use case. Description doesn't clarify what fields are searched or how results are ranked. Added context distinguishing this from similarity operations, clarified it searches metadata rather than lyrical content, and explained its role in the workflow for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: API endpoint to search songs from the database given a query
data.current_description:
Endpoint for an end-user client to search songs from the database given a String query.

If you want to run the /song/search operation, you can do so via an HTTP GET command to the following URL:

```
https://searchly.asuarez.dev/api/v1/song/search
```
data.summary_suggestion: Search songs by title or metadata query
data.description_suggestion: Searches the song database for songs matching a query string. Accepts a search query parameter and returns matching songs based on metadata (title, artist, etc.) from the 100k song database. This operation performs keyword-based search rather than lyrical similarity matching, making it useful for finding specific songs before performing similarity analysis.
data.reasoning: Original summary and description lack specificity about search scope (metadata vs. lyrics) and use case. Description doesn't clarify what fields are searched or how results are ranked. Added context distinguishing this from similarity operations, clarified it searches metadata rather than lyrical content, and explained its role in the workflow for better AI agent understanding.
